Thereâs no easy way to say this: these cuts are devastating. The Presidentâs request for just Mars exploration is $361 million, a crippling $226M drop in funding over the FY12 estimate, a 38.5% cut.

Read that again: a 38.5% cut. This will effectively halt the new exploration of Mars. It means pulling out of planning the ExoMars mission with the European Space Agency â effectively cancelling the mission, which will not make the Europeans happy â and also halting planning on a 2016 mission. There is still funding for the MAVEN mission scheduled for launch next year, but at reduced levels.
quote-source: The Bad Astronomer on brutal NASA cuts proposed by the Obama administration
